question: [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/public_parameters.rs] [Function: try_from()] [Decompression cost] Does G2Projective::from_compressed() have bounded computation time, or can crafted inputs cause expensive decompression operations that DoS validator nodes? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/public_parameters.rs] [Function: new_from_seed()] [Hash-to-curve cost] Can attackers force validators to repeatedly compute expensive hash_to_curve operations by triggering frequent parameter regeneration? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/public_parameters.rs] [Function: new_from_seed()] [Deterministic guarantees] Is hash_to_curve deterministic across different platforms and architectures, or can floating point or endianness differences cause validators to compute different parameters? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/public_parameters.rs] [Function: default_with_bls_base()] [Generator consistency] Is G1Projective::generator() guaranteed to return the same element across all blstrs library versions, or could library updates break determinism? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/das/public_parameters.rs] [Function: to_bytes()] [Canonical serialization] Is the byte representation canonical and deterministic, or can the same logical parameters serialize to different byte arrays causing consensus issues? (High)
